H0.text: Hot and dry environments are where cactus plants grow best.

H1.text: Hot and wet environments are the habitats where cactus plants grow best.

H2.text: Cold and dry environments are the best habitats for cactus plants.

H3.text: Cold and wet environments are the habitats in which cactus plants grow best.

A4.text: Cacti are adapted to live in very dry environments, including the Atacama Desert, one of the driest places on Earth.

A5.text: The minimum winter temperature required depends very much on the species of cactus involved. For a mixed collection, a minimum temperature of between 5 째C (41 째F) and 10 째C (50 째F) is often suggested, except for cold-sensitive genera such as Melocactus and Discocactus.
